page.title: 06Wrea Green Primary School(2)
page.content: The school building consists of ten rooms, of which 4 are everyday classrooms. There are also - a hall, library, music room, staffroom, headteacher's office and entrance hall. There are many special events in the year, one of them being Speech Day when prizes are given and each class performs a play for the parents. In Autumn there is a Harvest Festival service in church and afterwards the older children take baskets of fruit round the village to the older folk. Another service is the founders' day service on St Thomas' day in December when the children take the complete service in church. The children wear a school uniform for girls a navy blue dress with white bouse and school tie: for boys grey trousers, grey shirt and school tie.
